title: 113_s1318
content: The Act may be cited as the "Helping Ensure Life- and Limb-Saving Access to Podiatric Physicians Act" or the "HELLPP Act." Podiatrists are to be included as physicians under the Medicaid program. The Social Security Act is amended to include podiatrists as physicians under the Medicaid program. The effective date for the amendment is January 1, 2014, with an extension for state law amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to include podiatrists as physicians under the Medicaid program, effective January 1, 2014, with an extension for state law amendments. States must meet additional requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the close of the regular legislative session. MODIFICATIONS TO REQUIREMENTS FOR DIABETIC SHOES UNDER MEDICARE. Modifications to Medicare requirements for diabetic shoes include the provision of therapeutic shoes with inserts for individuals with diabetes under a comprehensive care plan managed by a physician. The provision of therapeutic shoes with custom inserts must be prescribed by a qualified physician for individuals with diabetes under a comprehensive care plan. Individuals with diabetes may receive therapeutic shoes with custom inserts prescribed by a qualified physician for conditions like peripheral neuropathy, callus formation, foot deformity, amputation history, or poor circulation. The shoes must be fitted by a podiatrist or other qualified supplier. The effective date for the amendment is January 1, 2014. SEC. 4. Budget savings by strengthening Medicaid program integrity through continuous levy on payments to Medicaid providers and suppliers. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code includes Medicaid payments to providers or suppliers under a State plan. Effective for levies issued after the enactment of this Act.
